intro: Chavica miniata var. hirtella, commonly known as the hairy chervil, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. It is an annual or biennial herb that thrives in temperate climates. Its delicate appearance and aromatic foliage make it a notable species in botanical gardens and wildflower habitats.
